pr_title: Some tiny English fixes from reading guides

timeline.message:
Some tiny English fixes from reading guides

Signed-off-by: Gordon Hutchison <Gordon.Hutchison@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: Are you sure about this one? When I search google I see that both are valid, or am I mistaken?
timeline.author: geoand
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -93,5 +93,5 @@ Your application is accessible at the printed URL.
 
 This guide covered the deployment of a Quarkus application on Kubernetes and OpenShift.
 However, there is much more, and the integration with these environments has been tailored to make Quarkus applications execution very smooth.
-For instance, the health extension can be used for health check; the configuration support allows mounting the application configuration using config map, the metric extension produces data _scrappable_ by Prometheus and so on.
+For instance, the health extension can be used for health check; the configuration support allows mounting the application configuration using config map, the metric extension produces data _scrapable_ by Prometheus and so on.

replies.bodyText:
Yes :-)
https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/scrappable
https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/scrapable
https://www.thefreedictionary.com/scrapable  (and find "scrapable adj" )
I can also derive it..
There are two distinct meanings - for scrapage and scrappage and scrapable or scrappable - one from 'scrape' (as in scraping ice off my car window) and one from 'scrap' (as in scrapping my old rusty car)  It is the long 'a' sound in scrape made with the 'split digraph' that is carried into scrapable and this only works with the single consonant 'p'. Indeed this is sometimes written with a 'magic e' as 'scrapeable' but scrapable is an acceptable alternative.
https://www.yourdictionary.com/scrapeable
I am certain that scrappable does not have the meaning we want here.
replies.author: hutchig
